say.phrase: The ocean is a body of saline water that covers two thirds of the earth's surface.

picture.source: By Tiago Fioreze (Own work) [CC BY-SA 3.0 (https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/3.0) or GFDL (http://www.gnu.org/copyleft/fdl.html)], via Wikimedia Commons

say.phrase: The Arctic Ocean is the smallest and shallowest of the world's five major oceans.

picture.source: By CIA - CIA World Factbook (https://www.cia.gov/library/publications/the-world-factbook/geos/xq.html), Public Domain, https://commons.wikimedia.org/w/index.php?curid=7627324

say.phrase: The Atlantic Ocean is the second largest of the world's oceans with a total area of about 41,100,000 square miles. It covers approximately 20 percent of the Earth's surface and about 29 percent of its water surface area.

picture.source: By Catrin (Own work, Using GMT) [GFDL (http://www.gnu.org/copyleft/fdl.html) or CC BY-SA 3.0 (https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/3.0)], via Wikimedia Commons

say.phrase: The Indian Ocean is the third largest of the world's oceanic divisions, covering 27,240,000 sq miles, approximately 20% of the water on the Earth's surface.

picture.source: By United States Central Intelligence Agency - The World Factbook, Public Domain, https://commons.wikimedia.org/w/index.php?curid=89448

say.phrase: The Pacific Ocean is the largest and deepest of Earth's oceanic divisions.

picture.source: By CIA World Factbook - CIA World Factbook, Public Domain, https://commons.wikimedia.org/w/index.php?curid=7627409

say.phrase: The Southern Ocean, also known as the Antarctic Ocean[1] or the Austral Ocean,[2][note 4] comprises the southernmost waters of the World Ocean, generally taken to be south of 60° S latitude and encircling Antarctica.

picture.source: By Connormah - Own work by uploader, based on File:Location Antarctica.svg, CC BY-SA 3.0, https://commons.wikimedia.org/w/index.php?curid=8029654

say.phrase: Fish have backbones, gills and fins, and are cold blooded.
Jellyfish or jellies[1] are softbodied, free-swimming aquatic animals with a gelatinous umbrella-shaped bell and trailing tentacles.
Whales are a widely distributed and diverse group of fully aquatic placental marine mammals.
